briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of Lusutrombopag for Thrombocytopenia in Patients With Chronic Liver Disease Undergoing Elective Invasive Procedures
officialTitle: A Phase 3 Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of S-888711 (Lusutrombopag) for the Treatment of Thrombocytopenia in Patients With Chronic Liver Disease Undergoing Elective Invasive Procedures (L-PLUS 2)
summary: The primary purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy of lusutrombopag with placebo for the treatment of thrombocytopenia in patients with chronic liver disease who are undergoing elective invasive procedures.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Required No Platelet Transfusion Prior to the Primary Invasive Procedure and No Rescue Therapy For Bleeding From Randomization Through 7 Days After the Primary Elective Procedure
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From Randomization to 7 days after the invasive procedure, up to approximately 21 days.
